Day Trips in Luxor Luxor Ancient Ruins Architecture Tours in Luxor Hot Air Balloon Rides in Luxor
This desert valley contains the ancient burial ground of many Egyptian pharaohs. Among over 60 royal tombs is the famous Tomb of Tutankhamen that was found in pristine condition. A temple built for the ritual practices exercised at the most important Ancient Egyptian festival, The Festival of Opet. A museum featuring items found beneath the Luxor Temple, and from the tomb of King Tut. Also on exhibit is a re-assembled wall from the Temple of Aten. A mortuary temple dedicated to the longest ruling female of Ancient Egypt, Queen Hatshepsut. The temple is decorated with statues, sphinxes The tomb of King Tut was discovered in the Valley of the Kings in 1922 by Howard Carter and Lord Carnarvon. This ancient complex is dominated by the massive memorial temple of Ramses III, similar to the mortuary temple of Ramses II at Ramesseum. #2 of 77 things to do in Luxor Ancient Ruins, Points of Interest and Landmarks, Monuments and Statues The key feature of this tomb, which was originally built for Ramses V and expanded by Ramses VI during the 20th Dynasty #10 of 77 things to do in Luxor History Museums #1 of 55 Mediterranean in Luxor #1 of 122 Restaurants in Luxor #2 of 55 Mediterranean in Luxor #2 of 122 Restaurants in Luxor #1 of 16 International in Luxor #3 of 122 Restaurants in Luxor #1 of 4 Healthy in Luxor #4 of 122 Restaurants in Luxor #1 of 11 Italian in Luxor #5 of 122 Restaurants in Luxor #2 of 16 International in Luxor #7 of 122 Restaurants in Luxor #4 of 55 Mediterranean in Luxor #10 of 122 Restaurants in Luxor Salah Al Din Al Ayoubi, Luxor Egypt Khaled Ben El Walid Street, Luxor 85111 Egypt New Karnak, Luxor Egypt El Sahabi Street Via Luxor Temple St, Luxor 85951 Egypt Corniche El Nile Street, Luxor Egypt West Bank Hager Al Dabbeya, Luxor 23502 Egypt
